sentences.en: A one-night stay in a modest hotel costs around £35.
sentences.cn: 在普通的旅店里过一夜要花费约35英镑。

sentences.en: Be modest when you are on the crest of the wave.
sentences.cn: 在最得意的时候要谦虚.

sentences.en: Even the relatively modest sum of £50,000 now seems beyond his reach.
sentences.cn: 现在即使是相对来说并不算多的5万英镑对他来说也是遥不可及的。

sentences.en: He charged a relatively modest fee.
He made a name for himself in science, but he remained modest.
sentences.cn: 他虽然在科学上出了名, 但仍然很谦虚.

sentences.en: He was modest to the point of self-effacement.
sentences.cn: 他过于谦虚，甚至到了自我轻视的程度。

sentences.en: He was too modest to claim the credit.
Lord Carrington is modest about his achievements.
sentences.cn: 卡林顿勋爵对自己取得的成绩非常谦虚。

sentences.en: Personally he was quiet, modest and unobtrusive.
sentences.cn: 私下里他文静、谦虚、不事张扬。

sentences.en: Swiss unemployment rose to the still modest rate of 0.7%.
sentences.cn: 瑞士的失业率上升到了0.7%，这个百分比仍然不算太高。

sentences.en: The gain will be commensurately modest.
The result reflects a modest rightward shift in opinion.
sentences.cn: 结果显示舆论出现一定程度的右倾。

sentences.en: The wine towns encountered are, on the whole, quiet and modest.
sentences.cn: 所到的酒镇总的来说都是宁静祥和的。

sentences.en: There has been a modest upturn in most parts of the industry.
sentences.cn: 该行业的绝大部分领域都出现了一定程度的好转。

sentences.en: They had spent the night at a modest hotel.
sentences.cn: 他们在一家普通的旅馆过夜。

sentences.en: Though his background was modest, it was in no sense deprived.
sentences.cn: 尽管他家境一般，但也并不算贫穷。

sentences.en: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.cn: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

trans.tran_cn: 不太大的，适中的，谦虚的，端庄的
trans.tran_en: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

trans.tran_cn: (Modest)人名；(罗)莫代斯特；(德)莫德斯特；(俄)莫杰斯特
